chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Duane Whirry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  IID for a period of 2 years to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

miscConds.notes: Jail sentence WITH HUBER PRIVILEGES may be served in Pierce, Pepin, St Croix, Dunn or Polk County

Comply with any conditions imposed by the probation agent 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Successfully complete the Pierce County Drug Court Program
Complete Victim Impact Panel

03:34 Defendant Joseph Duane Whirry in court. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed request for IID, defendant states he had it installed January 2016. Court will issue an order that defendant's IID period is completed as of 10/12/2017. 03:40

for Ignition Interlock Exemptions and Removing Title Transfer Stops
Faxed to DOT/ L/M for Joseph.

Defendant Joseph Duane Whirry in Court with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  DA Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:35 a.m.  DA Froelich informs Court that Defendant will be pleading to charges and recites agreement; two years Probation, license revocation of two years as well as ignition interlock.  $1872 fine, victim impact panel, driver safety plan, and six months in Jail.  Court questions period of Probation, DA Froelich notes correction, they are requesting three years.  Court questions Defendant, advises of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant admits to meth use but understands and pleads Guilty to Count One, Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance, 6th.  Atty. Nelson stipulates to facts.  Court finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarily and knowingly entered Plea.  Court accepts Plea and adjudicates.  DA Froelich makes statement and requests Court approve agreement.  Atty. Nelson makes argument, requests two years Probation and lower fine.  States Defendant may appear in Drug Court tomorrow but requests not reporting to Jail until December 26.  Court sentences Defendant, withheld.  -Three years probation; subject to any conditions of Agent.  -Specific conditions of Probation include: successfully complete Pierce County Drug Program. -Alcohol assessment.  - Driver's Safety Plan.  -6 months in Pierce County Jail, to report no later than 9:00 a.m. on December 26, 2014.  Court grants Huber for work.  -Two year license revocation. -Two years Ignition interlock.  -$1872 fine, $50 ignition interlock surcharge.
filed by Sean Froelich
Plea hearing on December 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 9, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Information is filed with the court. Def has copy and waives the reading.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY Court accepts the plea and will set for PTC
